message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG 

The paper discusses the challenges and opportunities in designing and developing an interactive task learning system that involves both human and AI agents. The focus is on incorporating recent advances in AI with HCI principles in mixed-initiative interactions and multi-modal interactions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also discusses the use of AI techniques such as natural language processing and machine learning, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the use of information retrieval techniques, which suggests that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Lastly, the paper discusses the lessons learned from the development of the SUGILITE system, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
